text: Aroma: horseradish, fruit and citrus, a little brine, funny. Taste: slightly acidic, citrus, peel, fruit, very refreshing.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Westbrook tap takeover @Chmielarnia Marszałkowska Warszawa 
Fruity, a bit salty, sour, mid low carbonation
2013 vintage. Świetne, mocno kwaśne i wytrawne, lekko mineralne gose, yuzu robi wspaniałą robotę.
Kran w Chmielarni. Aromat yuzu, siana, limonka. Smak kwaśny w średnich zakresach, dużo cytrusów. Bardzo miłe i odświeżające piwo.
tap/chmielarnia. bursztynowe, brudnopomarańczowe, z niemal zerową pianą. w aromacie herbata z miodem i cytryną, w smaku kwaśność owocowa, gładkie.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Westbrook Brewing Co. by GozuRami Rami is drinking a Gozu by Westbrook Brewing Co. at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaRzesko milo - jak na gose to klasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

On tap at Himmeriget. Pours a slightly hazy amber with a small off-white head. Dry and sour with aromas of sour dough rye and some lemon. Seems not really fresh. Medium bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Dry and sour finish with notes of yuzu.

Draft @ Himmeriget a little while back. Wanted to review after trying the normal WB Gose. This is a step-up from an already good beer. There is lots of yuzu that brigs out the citrus taste as well. So the acidic balance, saltiness, and thirst-quenching aspects are there, but it tastes that much better. Yuzu seems to be a great tool for sour or funky beers. Great stuff, probably my favorite Gose so far.
Tasted from the tap on the 12/02/2016. This is a marvelous juice!!! Plenty of orange, peach, lemon and other fruits. Next one please!

Merci à Roger pour le partage! Une Gose pour moi très différente de celles que jai goûté jusquà présent. Je suis dabord surpris par ce nez qui me rappelle une confiture de fraises Double Fruits qui emboîte le pas à un vinaigre de vin rouge. Comme si ces arômes nétaient pas suffisamment contradictoires, je note également beaucoup de bois pourri servant depuis longtemps de support à des champignons. Où suis-je sil-vous-plaît? Bon, je goûte. Malts jeunes en bouche et Yuzu citronné. Une acidité importante du fruit se manifeste en attaque avec une profondeur intéressante qui ressemble à la contribution dun noyau de fruit rouge tel la cerise. Le sel dans la bière est cohérent au style. Jusque là tout se passe correctement. cest la finale qui pour moi est difficile à supporter. Une fois les fruits tombés, lacidité demeure et cest le champignon et le bois putride qui reprennent le dessus dans une longue finale râpeuse qui je dois le dire, me suggère un insupportable goût de vomi (la gorgée sûre qui remonte parfois lors de la digestion). Une expérience.
650ml bottle. Saltier rendition, big kettle sour notes of green apple, has some autolyzed yeast character in the finish that when blended with the salt gives an impression of marmite.

[ 22oz Bottle ][ 7oz ][ @tasting ][ $ - ? ][ Snifter ][ 07.13.15 ]Shimmering translucent gold, frothy large bubbled white head. High acid, light salt nose, stinging peach and lotion. Dusty high acid front palate, plenty of lemon and peach, lightly metallic hints with plenty of lactic mid palate, acid lightly vinous through the stinging grape finish, zesty carb helps though body too full.

Pour is golden yellow with lots of tight white head. Nose has a fairly bright citrus, light salt, faint wheat, white pepper. Flavor has a lot of juice and citrus to it, gets a little oily from the juice, moderate acidity, lighter body, assertive carb.

Medium offwhite head. Clear amber body with carbonation. Earthy
peachy rhubarb aroma with salty funky notes. Dry-acidic yuzu orangey
taste with spicy notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel.
Dry-acidic delicately spicy yuzu aftertaste with wooden notes. Quite
nice and easy to drink. The yuzu really adds to it, but the sourness
and other aspects kind of get in the way for me. (0.65l bottle, from
Fish & Beer, Copenhagen.)

Bottle on a buse. Lightly tart/acidic with a mild fruitiness. Cloudy off yellow pour. Taste is mildly tart with a general fruitiness to it. Never had yuzu so I guess thats what Im tasting. Overall very pleasant fruit and sour combo
On tap at the brewery, pours a hazy gold with a ring of white head. Nose has an odd parmesean note, lemon, lime, salty. Flavor has heavy parm rind, lemon, a little olive. Heavy finish.

On tap at tasting room. Great, but like the traditional version just a bit better. All the good notes of the gose- nice and sour, salty and super crisp. Yuzu adds nice acidity/ citrus notes. Super tasty.
Slightly cloudy straw gold. Nose of lemon citrus, wheat, lacto. Light salt, earthy citrus, wheat, light lactic yogurt funk. Great aperitif brew and good accompaniment to some fancy ramen.

Golden straw yellow, hazy. Almost no head. 
citrusy blood orange, grapefruity aroma.
tart, fresh and funky flavour.
Bottle. Yellow hazy pour with white head. Gozu, light citrus, nice funk flavors. What gose should be.

Pale yellow colour, white head. Citrusy aroma, gose, wheat, apple, fruits. Sour flavour, salt, funk, lots of yuzu. Really fresh. Finish citrus and lactic acid.(from draught @ CBC blue session, Copenhagen 2014. Thanks for sharing todays beers, RateBeer crew!)
Hazy golden. Small, frothy offwhite head. Orange, citrus aroma, light funk. Sour, tart flavour, citrus turning juicy and salty. Dry yet juicy, lively carb. Nice.
Citrusy, sour, wheaty, acidic nose. Light haze, pale orange, small white head. Quite tart and acidic, citrusy - grapefruit and orange, salty finish. Refreshing and delicious.

Clear deep golden with a thin dissipating head. Very nice aroma featuring salt and passionfruit and guava. Big tart flavor of salty tropical juicy fruit and a little oaked sour funkiness. Lots of guava and lightly sour saltiness. Really complex and tasty.

Bottle shared @ Ma che siete venuti a fà. Gialla torbida con riflessi aranciati, leggeremente opalescente, schiuma leggera poco persistente. Al naso sentori di scorza darancia, limone, lattica, leggera speziata, intensa, notevole. In bocca mostra un buon equilibrio, originale, ma senza eccessi, acida e salata, aumenta la salivazione invogliando a berne sempre di più. Corpo leggero, ottima bevibilità. Davvero un bel prodotto.

Aroma: Salt, Wheat, Corriander, Mild Citrus

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Mild Lacing

Taste: Lime Juice, Hay, Wheat, Salt, Corriander

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Salty, Semi Tart, Semi Bitter
22 oz bottle from Mile High Wine & Spirits. Aroma and flavor of sour notes, coriander, citrus zest, funky yeast, tart fruits and light salt. Refreshing and easy to drink with a tart/sour finish.

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy golden hue with fizzy white head that settled. Aroma is lactic, straw, salmon berries, citrus. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry with a salty tartness following that extended through the finish. Overall this is a very nice brew!

Bottle at home. Pour is hazy orange with a big white white head and good lacing. Huge guava/passion fruit aroma - super funky, lactic, some lemons, saltiness, and urine in the aroma. Taste is big guava, lemons, briney, doughy, lacto, vanilla, some rancid notes and tartness. Medium body with high carbonation. The weird guava/acetic notes dont do it for me. Much prefer the original.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2014 Bottle - thanks Eric! Pours clear pale golden, small white head, some lacing. Aroma is light lemon, wheat, lemongrass. Flavor is very light tart, a bit salty, wheat, zesty lemon. Light body.
Fresh salty smell. Taste is light sourness with salt and citrus. Nice sharp carbonation.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour is citrus, malt, salt, yuzu juice, coriander, berries. Weird beer, but still a interesting one.
Frischer Antrunk mit säuerlichen Saftnoten. Minimale Bitterkeit, die auch vom Saft zu kommen scheint, weiterhin zitronig. Salzig, Essignoten. 8/9/12/12/11/11
Tap at CBC 2014. Beer in the glass light yellow, small head. Sourish-moldy aroma. Starts salty-sourish, not too intense, fine fruity like lemon. Well balanced finish, sourish-bitter aftertaste. Nice!

Bomber from the brewery. Pours a shade darker than the gose, its cloudy and sort of orange. Aroma is tart with hints at lemon, salt and juicy, fruity notes which I must assume to be yuzu. The flavor is nice and balanced. The addition of yuzu makes this an interesting variation of their gose, but not necessarily for the better in my humble opinion. The fruit certainly blends in nicely and adds some balance, but it takes away from the delicious, subtle complexity of the grains, salt and yeast. Id definitely drink this if I did not have access to their gose, but otherwise Id reach for the latter every time.

Bottle via a trade before RAT. Extrad. Pours a very light yellow to orange with small white head. Aroma is an odd astringent lemon peel and sour citrus. Taste is slight pledge, funk and more acetic sour. As it warms it has more of an off citrus flavor to it.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Unclear yellow golden color with a fine white head. Good lacing. Very inviting and fresh aroma. Citric, mild salty, sour and acidic. A fine body for a beer at 4%. Fresh bitterness, Balanced sourness and acidity. Complex and nice. A mix between lambic, cider and lemon radler. Lots of citrus, sour and acidic, herbal and some salt.[Bottle from a trade with Gunnar]

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, blue session. 02/05/2014. Aroma is stale orange, straw malts, salty.Clouded pineapple juice looking pour with a loose white head. Some tart beery in the nose. Flavour is salty, slightly tart berry, orange and a little acid. Lingering earthy notes and straw. Good good shit.

Clear golden colour with a white head. Yeasty, acidic aroma with lemon, wheat, orange, coriander, herbal notes. Medium body with prickly carbonation. Really nice, quite sour flavour with lemon, grapefruit, salt, spices and toast. Very nice and interesting.
Bottle sample at Muckfest V on 7/12/14. Cloudy yellow pour with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, soft fruit and funkiness. Malty and lemony flavor with a tart candy finish.
On tap at CBC 2014. Pale hazy golden with white head. Aroma is sour, fruity, fresh, coriander and some bitter notes. Taste is sour, big flavor, berries, bitter and salty.
Sampled at the RBSG 2014. It poured a hazy pale golden color with a white head. The aroma was a bit fruity. The taste was sour with some lemon juice. Nice.
Bottle share at SRBG 2014. Pours a cloudy light gold with a small white head. Aroma of fruit, spice, and funk. Taste is tart fruit, coriander, funk, and salt. Very good!

Sample @ RBWG, Asheville. Hazy gold with a small head. Strong mineral on the nose. Salty sandbox, wood, lemon squash. The taste is bracingly tart. A bit of earthy tea and lemon. Pretty dry. Light body, active carbonation.
Bottle - Lemon, mandarin, chalk and some acidity. Hazy yellow with a thin white head. Soapy, lemon, orange and a nice salty tartness.

To begin I LOVE the regular gose. So this is a slam dunk with the Yuzu. Tried at Sourfest in St. Pete area. Small snifter. Pours a cloudy yellow with a thin head. Aroma of the Yuzu, coriander, bread, and slight yeasty funk. The taste is amazing with the Yuzu, spice coriander, salt, bread, and yeast funk lacto. So damn good. Light in body, bold in flavors. Man its good.
Sampled at RBSG. Funky sour salty and fruity in a nutshell. Tart but the saltiness is a nice offset. This is a fun beer. The fruit adds so much here. Just nice.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow pour, little bit of white head. Aroma, wow, big hits of citrus, salt, almost stings the nose. Taste, salty up front, some sweetness, big citrus notes. Fantastic stuff
Draught at CBC 2014. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, sourness, wheat, spice and tartness.

Bottle This beer can do a wheelie on a unicycle! Cloudy golden pour with a mid-sized, foamy, white head. The bright, fruity aroma offers a medley of key lime, yuzu, nectarine and lemon flesh with a nice, interwoven, bready element. Light to medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation. The flavor is a tart, citric swirl of key lime, lemon and yuzu with undercurrents of white bread and lightly sweet stone fruits. The acidity is crisp, acute and sparkling clean. Refreshing and delightful. World class beer!

650 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a small head. Aroma of sharp citrus, salt water and spiciness. A bit 7up-like at first. Flavour of heavy salt water, sharp orange notes, coriander and sharp tartness. Nice acidity. Light bodied and quite heavy mouthfeel because of the saltiness. Dry, sharp, juicy finish. Very refreshing. Unique interpretation of a gose, but theyve made this a bit too easy. Their Gose is much better without yuzu.

65 cl bottle @ Timo A. Thanks lusikka!
Pours cloudy golden color with a minimal head. Feels like a grape fruit lemonade with the first smell, some herbs and yeast also. Quite heavy palate, hard water, slight salt notes, grape fruits, lemon, some wood and sourish fruit notes. Surprisingly refreshing, quite difficult to decide how to rate this, on the other hand very refreshing and tasty beverage but as a Gose too "friendly" and light. Ill go with the all-round feel as a very tasty beer.
2345

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 2nd Session. Pours yellow pale with a small head, aroma is slightly sour with lactic notes and saltiness, flavor of cheese, lemon, yogurt, floral tones, medium bodied. nice.

Tap sample at CBC 2014. Pours a thick milky pale straw yellow body with a small white head. Nose is lactic sour wheat, tropical fruits (yuzu I guess) peaches, hints of straw and honey. Taste is sour lactic tones, cereals, fruity wine gum-like tones, hints of straw and peaches. Medium body, high carbonation. Ok, but the fruit thing doesnt really do much for me.
Thanks GT2! Gold pour, white head, citrus nose, very tart flavor, a pretty interesting sour overall.
UPDATED: MAY 22, 2014 A little more barnyard than the gose. More salt too. More sour, more fresh grapefruit.

Bottle @ GTs Cat Cabana. Hazy golden pour with a tall white head. Nice citrusy nose. A light yogurt funk, yeast, bright lemon/yuzu, some orange, and green melon. A touch of cracker malt, as well. Flavor is nicely acidic and tart. Great citrus character. Lots of yuzu, orange zest, and yogurt. Tangy. Mild malt presence, mostly cracker, and fairly dry.
[5/2/14] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. 2nd session. Cloudy pale yellow. Lovely aroma, lactic and lemony. Sour flavor, lactic and lemony. Quite light-bodied. Great and refreshing.
Sampled at Dark Lord Day 2014. Poured cloudy gold with a white head. Citrus nose. Medium body. Favor is sour and with fruit. Finish is very intense and full of sour Really great beer.

Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration, second session. Pale yellow coloured body, hazy. No head, no lace. Mid-tart citrus nose. Citrus tartness to the taste buds, lightly spiced. Medium to thin bodied. Good partner to my Danish sandwiches (02.05.2014).

Sample from tap, CBC 2014. Cloudy, golden colour with a lasting, white head. Fruity aroma with salt, lots of citrus, lemon, wheat malts and a herbal-spicy note. Taste is light bitter. Light to medium body with a lighter texture. Finishes dry and fruity with citrus and salt. Very refreshing.

Sample at CBC 2014. 

Hazy light yellow with a small white head. Quite tart with citrus, oak, hay, funk, light spices and some salt. The body was light and the finish was dry. An ok one.
Sample @ CBC. Ppurs hazy pale yellow with a very small white head. Aroma is tart dominated by citrus. Taste is tart citrus, fruity, mid dry tart finish. Light/medium body.

CBC 2014. Pours a cloudy lime juice in color with no head. Aroma of orange and lime along with citrus and tartness. Taste is lime, citrus, orange, funk and some salt. Mouthfeel is very crisp and dry with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is citrus, orange and salt with some nice funky tart notes.

650ml bottle from Bierkompass


First Gose for me. Light yellow outfit with tiny white foam which disappears fast. Tart aroma with citric tones. Very juicy, citric and little bit sour taste. Not so sour and good what I exptected but OK. First feels kinda unilateral but gets better when warm up.

Draught at Fermentoren, CopenhagenMuddy blond color with creamy head. Sour aroma, a bit vinous, and citrusy. Lemony flavor, dry but somehow smooth, with moderate saltiness; correct bitterness.It delivers a fresh feeling, nice beer.

Tap @ CBC 2014. Pours murky pale yellow with a small, white film head. Aroma has pear, apple, citrus. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and light mouthfeel. Flavour has dry what, citrus zest, apple. Good tartness. Okay.

Sample @ CBC 14. Pours a murky pale golden beer without any head. Aroma is corny, slight funky and thin. Flavor has loads and loads of corn, slight salty aftertaste. Very thin mouthfeel. Not very impressive.
Tap at the Copenhagen beer festival... Light hazy yellow... Thin white lacing... Tart dry salty fruits... Fizzy.. Sharp funky lemon

Hvidgylden uklar 
Citrus mælk frugtsaft 
Bitter moderat sur modrate 
Tør livlig 
@cbc 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 22oz. An unclear, golden beer topped by a dense, white head. Lots of citrus on the nose, with citrus fruit, some grapefruit and lemon and a faint spiced, salty touch. Perhaps a bit one dimensional, but very pleasant. Its pretty much the same in the flavor, lots of citrus going on, and a little touch of saltyness and coriander. Citrusy finish. Sure a nice idea adding the yuzu to the gose. 140426

Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma of lemon, fruitiness, citrus and sour fruits. Flavor is sour and fruity with some salt, coriander, lemon, citrus and berries. Medium to thin body, average carbonation.

Bottle 650ml @ Geokkjer
Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, lime, wheat, citric acid. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a citrus, sour, salty finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Craziness. But definitely worth trying. MUCH stronger than a traditional Gose, but in a good American way. Will try again. Borderline too much, but still enjoying the first glass too much to talk anything against it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle I split with Jenny while yelling at the screen watching my Gators lose their Final Four game to eventual champ UConn. Light, slightly cloudy yellow pour. Aroma is awesomely doughy, salty, with mild fruit and cereal. Flavor is heavier on the fruit juice. Fairly acidic with a sharp bite. Soft lingering salt and dough notes. I think the yuzu actually gets in the way of a phenomenal gose. Its still really good, but I prefer the gose.
Pours a hazy golden yellow with a small off white head. The smell is huge lemon, salt. Very salty and lemony...some grain ending sour and dry...super. Light body with nice active carbonation.

Many thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing. Very citric and intense in the nose. The beer starts great fruity-sour. Very easy to drink and still intense. Great sourness with yuzu-flavour. Fresh and intense. The aftertaste is long, intense-fruity, great sourness and very intense-fresh!
--> absolutely great! 14/13/13/14

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Clear, pale, green tinged, yellow. No head. Lemon. Lime. Lime cordial. Taste is dry and tart. Fresh, clean, lively palate. Tart finish, with more of the lime cordial. Nice beer.

Bottle from Vaaland, Bryne. Pours hazy golden with a small tight creamy white head. Aroma of fresh fruits, yuzu and mineral salts. Taste is light tarty, well carbonated, yuzu and light citrussy, very enjoyable and fresh beer.
Golden colour. Very tart, lemony sourness, salt, coriander. A very refreshing beer!

WOW!! What a beer!!!
Its my first Gose beer, but I think its enough to fall in love with the style.
Salty, sour, citrus-y...very fresh with a barn-a-like aftertaste.
AMAZING!!!
On tap at Barcelona Beer Festival 2014. Hazy gold color. Medium head. Medium carbonation. Medium sourness and bitterness. Salty. Fruity and bretty.

Bottles December 2013

Its golden and turbid with a soapy quilt. Smells of saline, some yogurt, some grain, a little bit of mineral. Flavor is tart, salty, some earth, some juice. Medium on full bodied, hi carb and a dry finish. The flavors are okay, but the overall composition doesnt do it for me.
Very pale and cloudy. Very tart, touch of citrus fruit, good balance and very refreshing. Touch of salt. Really nice sour.

650ml bottle. Hazy, opaque, yellow-ish, orangey, deep golden colour with small, frothy, diminishing, minimally lacing, white head. Juicy, fruity, citrusy and wheaty aroma, herbal overtones, notes of orange, quince, passion fruit, hints of vinegar, rotten/fermented apple. Taste is immensely tart, biting tartness, lots of lemon juice, yuzu, dryness, some passion fruit, slightly salty, especially in the finish. Superb!

Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of salt, plums, grapes, apples. Taste is salty, sour and fresh fruit. Light, crisp body. Yum!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Trappiste - pours a blond beer with a modest head retention; aroma of exotic yellow fruits; sourish and citric, medium-bodied, lively and fresh; subtle carbonation; pretty sour and light salty; very dry and long fruity sourish finish; tart - very pleasant and hugely drinkable

Bottle shared by b3shine. Poured a hazy yellow color with an average white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Good aroma of wheat, citrus and spice. Medium body with tingly texture and soft carbonation. Good sour citrus flavor with a complex sweet & sour finish of medium duration. Interesting complex brew.

Pours a hazy yellow-gold. Murky. Small frothy head fades quickly into spotty lacing. Aromas of lemonade, sea salt, wheat. Taste is nicely sour upfront with the lemonade flavors, salty across the middle with a light wheat-body. Pretty juicy beer. Finishes with a mouthwatering tart zest.

A- milky straw yellow with a thin white head that clings to the glass. Good lacing.

S- strong and rich lemon meringue and custard. Butter and cream. Light malts and simple sugar. Vanilla, 7up soda, baked pie crust. salt air and lime. 

M- light crisp body with a light to medium sweet and salty body. Good carbonation.

T- beautiful savory lemon curd notes in the beginning. Salt, yeast, yogurt and vanilla. Sugars and butter lead the middle with lime aid and soda water. Ending is tart yet clean with more citrus notes.

Bottle at home- 20th March 2014. Pours hazy pale golden colour. Thin head. Aroma of zesty lemons, melon, yoghurt. Flavour is salt, sour lemons, unripened mandarins. Ultra-refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: Shared bomber. Pours hazy golden with a nice frothy head that dissiptaes quickly. Aroma is lemonjuice and some wheat. Taste is tart, almost like pure lemon juice. Finishes of with a hint of salt.

Bomber to snifter (shared with the group; thanks Dogbones). Looks good; a hazy golden orange with thin white head that quickly dissipates into lacing. Smells good too; tart, salty, and citrusy. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly tart mouthfeel. Good stuff.

22 oz bottle shared by b3shine. Pours a hazy pale golden yellow color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have tart juicy fruit that must be the Yuzu, wheat, salt, citrus, sour opening then the salt kicks in, some juicy notes lead into a tart wheat, fruity finish.

Bottle shared by b3shine. Totally hazy kind of pale golden color. Thin white head, leaves good dots of lace. Super potent, tart nose. Nice mix of salt, yuzu, citrus. Mmm.. This is delicious. Great bigger tart taste, lightly salty, moderate sweet. Medium body, bigger than the 4% suggests. Smooth, kind of crisp lighter carbonation, lightly slick texture. Good wheat, lightly salty finish. Fantastic stuff. Creative, tasty, well-done.

Draught @ The Rover. Pours very hazy yellow with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is sour and slightly fruity with crackers, hay, lemon juice, Trocadero soda, saltines, lemon hard candy, lemon zest and hints of salt water and unflavored yogurt. Taste is sour, tiny salty and fruity with crackers, lemon juice, unflavored yogurt, Trocadero soda, hay, dry soil, lemon hard candy, passion fruit and hints of salt water and rubber. Mouthfeel is crisp, dry, tart, soft, mouth-puckering and medium bodied. Finish is sour and fruity with crackers, lemon juice, unflavored yogurt, lemon hard candy, lemon zest, dry soil, hay and hints of salt water. Damn delicious!!!

Rcvd in trade.
The appearance has a hazy somewhat golden/orange colored body with a half fingered white foamy head that dies within several minutes.
The smell has a strong tart/sour aromas coming out with a decent lemon/orange.
The taste has a strong bitter lemon up front to combine with a sour, tart, somewhat saltiness (and that whats saves it). As it all combines for a decent salty somewhat tart/sour refreshing aftertaste. There is no finish.
On the palate, she sits about a light to medium and comes across somewhat sessionable. Carbonation seems good for the style and for me as its not too harsh.
Overall, this is a very good Gose that I would have again.

Tasted on 2/7/14 from a capped 650mL bomber bottle at the Friday night tasting at RBWG Asheville, thanks to TheBeerSommelier for sharing. Pours hazy, very pale yellow with a thin white head that slowly recedes to a thin collar. The nose is tart lemon with a savory note. The flavor is straight up salty yuzu citrus with some wheat malt. The body is light with lively carbonation and a long, tart and salty finish.

This one poured a hazy yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of pale malt, cracked wheatr,lots of lemons, and saltiness. Flavor was definite salinity, tar lemons, and cracked wehat. Interesting gose.

Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. Hazy golden beer with a decent white head. Sourish tart aroma, biscuits, citrus, grapefruit notes, salty, bready, mango, grapes, some herbal notes. Sourish fruity flavor, hay, citrus, salty, grapes, floral, biscuits, some cereal notes. Really fresh with a great balance.

Draught at The Rover
Really tart aroma; sour citrus.
Sour flavour. 
Sweetish biscuits and sour citrus. 
Lacto-acid.

Pours hazy, dirty messy yellow. White small head. Aroma of yoghurt with sour apricot/peach-fruity notes to it. Bitter and citrussy. Lacto-bacteria, and wheat in the background. Smells pickled! Starts out very tart and sour. Like a dry champagne. Followed up by slight sweeter fruity notes. Both these before-mentioned apricots, but almost like sour orange-soda. Plain lemon juice comes to mind as well because of the rather flat carbonation. In the very end there is a whole lot of crispbread and more grainy nuances in the taste.
Both taste and aroma (and appearance) has some milky/cheesy bacteria/yeasty things to it.
Very exciting, very ugly, very hard to rate with a score, and it actually tastes pretty well.

Pours hazy dirty and messy yellow with almost no head. Not the prettiest girl from the block. Aroma has lots A38 (sour Yogurt), some sweet funny smelling citrus fruits. Also some classic german wheat beer, also some salty emmentaler, pickled Apricot, corrianer, Pickled apples and quite tart overall. Taste is like champaign in the beginning, then the the lacto bacterio comes in along with the sweeter citrus fruits. Alot of grainy notes in the end. German wheat beer notes is here as well along with some gueuze notes and I also get the pickled fruity stuff in the taste. I also get some salty cheesy notes. I will admit that this reminds me a bit of a sour danish orange/lemon soda (Nikoline) - but without the sugary part. Im quite positive with this beer and it was really a treat to try but the appearance and the palate is pulling this beer a bit down.
Geld, feine weisse schaumkrone, säuerlich fruchtig im aroma, antrunk leichte süsse von yuzu-frucht, dann säuerlich salzig, abgerundeter abgang

650 ml bottle courtesy of clt85. Thanks. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a small white head that soon diminishes to a fine ring. The aroma light with citrus including lemons and musty melons. The taste has a pronounced lemon lick with a big bready malt base is that is wonderfully delicious. The palate is light, but effective and the carbonation is lively. Finishes long and sour-sweet. Overall: Wow--awesome ale.
Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a cloudy yellow with small white frothy lacing. The aroma is salt, coriander, and funk. Medium mouthfeel with nice tart finish. So good and crisp. Very impressive.
Pours hazy pale golden with a good white.head. Aroma is acidy a bit fruity. Flavor is fresh sour acidy.nicely salty lemon juice. Has a touch of cheesy Flavor on the palate.

22oz bottle in a tulip. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, salt, coriander, some light tartness, some wheat and pale malts, and light spices. Flavor a great blend of everything. Average texture. A really cool beer.
Fresh can. Pours muddy yellow with no head. Aroma is lemon, grapefruit. Really vibrant aroma. Taste is sour lemon, coriander, orange juice. Salty , tart finish. Wow, powerful stuff. Instant fan.
Pour is a hazy golden straw with a white head. Aroma is very fruity and tart. Taste is tart with a little sweetness and coriander at the end. Leaves a dry aftertaste.

Amazing aroma. Citrus. Salty. Musty. Like huge citrus note. Lots of lemon. 
Looks like a hazy white wine. Bubbly head dissipates quickly. 
Taste is amazing. Salty. Citrus. Fruity. Fades..... But then whabam! Malty sweet finish with a bit of grapefruit bitterness. 
Palate is a bit aggressive but not too bad. Light. A little watery. 

This is an amazing beer. I was looking for something more from westbrooke and this was it. Can this!!! Can this!!!! CAN THIS!!!!!!! So good without insisting on itself. Probably The best light bodied beer I have had to date.
Duft av appelsin og salt vann. Dunkel gulbrun farge. Lite skum, liten ring langd kant. Frisk surlig appelsinsmak med en sursalt etersmak.
Dunkel lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av tropiskfrukt, krydder og gjær. Smak av tropiskfrukt og krydder. Sur og fruktig. Vaaland.

On tap at Øltorget, february 22nd 2014. Hazy yellow body, tiny head. Aroma of apricot marmelade, funk. coriander. Taste of sweet citrus fruits (yuzu I guess), tartness, a touch of cinnamon. Aftertaste is intense fruity, in total I find the beer a really nice refreshing treat

Bottle 22fl.oz.Unclear light to medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy zest, lemon, Schweppes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to modrate acidic with a long duration, zest, lemon, citrus, yeast, dry, Schweppes, light salty. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20131229]

750 ml bottle shared at Downtown Inn on Friday night of RBWG. Pours a very pale yellow color with a white head. Notes of lemon and lime, salt, wheat, sourdough, and yuzu. Lingering yuzu finish. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, clean mouthfeel. Excellent beer. Would like more of this.

[ Bottle ][ RBWG Afterparty2 ][ 22oz ][ Globe ][ Tasting ][ 2/7/14 ]
>> Thank you BeerSommelier for this wale. Pours cloudy, bright straw with fizzing down foam. Nose is insane Yuzu, super bright, holy monkey, pomelo, blood orange. Loving it. Taste is oh man so clean, mouthwatering low saltiness, balancing butter biscuit. Palate is bright, salty, buoyant, very tart. Theres a reason Rapp Gose and this baby are the top two Goses.

Dang this one is really interesting and really tasty. Light tropical fruit running all over the nose and palate. Finish is dry and salty and fruity again. Light overall and refreshing. A little wild yeast funk in the aroma as well. A touch fruitier and a touch less salty than straight up gose. Lemon lime tangerine and grapefruit. Green apple as well.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 16.02.2017, tap @ Schouskjelleren:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is very fresh citrusy, yuzu, citrus peel, tangerine, lemon, sorrel, soda powder. Taste is very citrusy acidic, yuzu, salt, sorrel, soda powder, lemon, citrus peel, grain. Nice fresh acidic citrusy mouthfeel. Very nice!

I love this beer. I want cases and cases of it. Aroma is lime sherbert, key lime pie, light citrus zest, and some spice. Taste is moderately sweet and really tastes like oykos key lime greek yogurt. Bright tart and delicious.

15th February 2014Scopey 5K Tasting in deepest Croydonia. Thanks to the main man. Hazy pale gold beer, small bubbly white head. Palate is crisp and dry. Mild minerals. Lovely tangerine - lemon floralness. Very light sherbet. Finishes light and dry with a sherbetty aftertaste. Delicious!

Bottle split at Scopeys 5K Extravaganza of Oompah Band meets doorbell music, big thanks to the man of the moment - 15/02/14. 
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is tangerine, lemon rind, citric ting, light smoke, straw, yuzu tang.
Taste comprises sharp yuzu, pithy orange, tangy mandarin, light bread dough, straw, earthy.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation with a lick of spritz, semi dry close.
Lovely refreshing stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at Scopeys 5000th rate. Cheers to Paul I think. A very hazy straw pour with a small beige rim leaving some nice legs. Huge yuzu on the nose as expected, quite peppery with some sugary sherbert. Taste is spicy and citric, sherbert like sweetness, very yuzu forward and a little candied. Loads of lemon tang. A touch spritzy in carbonation and quite sweet. Great for the style and fruit but I am stil finding the yuzu beers a little hit and miss

330 ml on tap @ "Schouskjelleren",Oslo.
Beer from a tulip glass
February 16,2013
Cloudy pale golden color with a thin white head and medium carbonation.
Aroma is sourish,tart, tequila,salt,lime and some fruit.
Taste is a bit sourish,salt and lime.
Ends with a salty and tart finish.
Not my favorite style and taste,but different and interesting.
A new type of beer style and taste for me.

Bottle at RBWG 2014, thanks! Pours a hazy pale gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a light tart fruit note with a bit of lime and a backing wheat note. Flavor has more of a tart citrus and lime note that is backed by a light wheat note.

Bottle at my 5K tasting. It pours cloudy pale gold with a small white head. The nose is fresh, mandarin, orange, lemony, Fanta icy lemon (Lorna) dough, minerals and salt. The taste is crisp, lemony, orange, grapefruit rind, minerals, mild acidity, salts, herbals notes and lemonade, with a dry finish. Light-medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Fresh, crisp, tart and very drinkable. Really rather tasty. Top drawer gose.

Appearance: Heavily hazed, dirtied yellow body with a thin, dissipating, white head. Nil lacing.

Smell: Sourish, briny nose with a touch of sourdough, wheat, and spoiled lemons that presents just a slightly fruitier quality than its predecessor.

Taste: Slight, muddled graininess, damp straw, and the sourdough with a vein of cream of wheat underneath the staunch, salty, lactic flavors. Jarring jolt of lemon juice bursts onto the scene soon, as with the original, but more of a defined, authentic fruitiness. The coriander remains rather subtle beneath the peppier elements. Still rather salty. Remains sour and tart on the salty, minerally, saliva-rushing finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light. Medium-plus.

Overall: Skanky and tart, but deliciously, even refreshingly so. Can you imagine? Can y-- Well, you can probably imagine, but yeah. Skanky and tart!

RBWG14 Trip Rating #39. Bottle shared by TBS at the Friday Night Downtown Inn Bottle Share. Pours a very pale yellow color with a thin white head. Aroma of strong salt, citrus, earth, spice, lemonade. The taste is tart lemonade, spice and citrus notes. Thin bodied, refreshing.
Bottle at RBWG, courtesy of thebeersommelier. Pours a hazy yellow color with white head. Really tart, lemon, salty flavors. Pretty sour.
Hazed yellow pour with white head. Aroma is a tart dry. Flavor mirrors the aroma with a nice dry finish. Medium body

Bottle @ RBWG Fart Share. Pours a hazy yellow appearance with a white head. Bright spicy guava / passion fruit, salty nose. Quite tart. Big star fruit / passion fruit, big lemony, tart flavor. Pretty fucken tart. Kind of an odd ball. I prefer the normal version better.

From the February 2014 3R6P tasting +++ Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very pale straw color with a large foamy yellow-white head that left a bit of lacing. The aroma was tart and chalky lemon, orange and Sweettart candies. The flavor was very tart and sour with lots of salt, lemon, and a bitey perfume. Long tart salt and lemon finish. Medium body.

Draft @ Manker Beer Blog birthday party.
App: Cloudy yellow with white fluffy head.
Aroma: Lots of lemon with a slight tropical touch to it, coriander, wheat and hay. Sour.
Taste: Very citric acidic with lots of lemon, soft wheaty malts, coriander and salty aftertaste.
Palate: Medium to light bodied with soft tickling carbonation.
Overall: Lemony and refreshing, but the salty aftertaste is a bit tiresome.

Bottle. Cloudy pale gold with small white head. Tart sour and citrusy aroma and vanilla. Tart and tangy. Light and dry. Malty cereal, salt, soft lemons, grapefruit, and maybe some peach-like notes. Similar to the gose with more citrus and fruit notes.

pours hazy yellow with a fluffy white head. Nose is intense citrus, limes, lemons, spicy citrus peel, very tart nose. Flavor is similar, super tart citrus, fruits, limes. It starts out really really citrusy and tart them immediately fades the acidity to nothing. Really pretty interesting in the sense that the sourness fades so quickly. Really liked it. I does not smell like dog food, Steve.

Hazy, straw colored yellow. Aroma is sour fruit and lemon with a touch of saltiness. Flavor is very salty with a big hit of lemon. Sourness comes through in the finish. Leaves a bit of citrus in the aftertaste.

Wife: 4

Draught at Fermentoren.
Hazy golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of lactic acid and lemon juice.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of lactic acid with notes of lemon juice.
Fruity finish.

Poured a murky golden yellow color with aromas of yuzu, salt, lemon and light wheat. Flavors are the same light yuzu and salt made this beer refreshing on the palate and after each sip I wanted more. Another solid beer from Westbrook.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of yuzu fruits, malt, and sugar. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, salt, yuzu, and malt, leading to a tart finish.

Bottle. Aroma is lemon, yuzu, earth, and barnyard. Appearance is cloudy, but bright yellow. White head and good lacing. Taste is sour lemon, yuzu, salt, funk, and wood. Creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall nice and sour but still refreshing.

Bottlle shared with a few noncraft brew drinkers. They did not like it, thus they only received 1 oz each. I on the other hand thought it was lovely. Poured murky orange with off white head. Smell is tropical fruits, bready/wheat, known salt. Taste is what is the star here. Taste is cirtus, honeydue melon, tart yuzu juice, wheaty malt and the saltiness of a gose. Better than the original.

Bomber. Pours a hazy straw with thick foamy white head. Aroma of warheads candy. Taste just like it too. Wheat, citrus, lemon, salt, and the yuzu will make you pucker. Sea salt is on the finish which kills the lingering super sourness. Very nice.
If you like Gose, you will love Gozu. Freaking beautiful fruit ester nose. Golden color. Great salty flavor with just enough sour and fruit. Yes, PLEASE!

22oz bomber sample courtesy of dak. It pours with a slightly opaque deep gold body that supports a near white head of foam. The aroma offers up sweetness, sweet candied coriander, a bit of floral hoppiness and a touch of salt. The taste is similar with spices, floral hops, a dash of grainy malts and then rimmed with a nice degree of saltiness into the finish. Pretty solid.

Pours a cloudy yellow from the bottle with dissipating white head that leaves light lace. Aroma is still that nice sour briny quality of the regular gose but a nice sweet citrus back. Taste follows, bright citrus notes covering the briny sour of the original. Good carbonation, bubbly and refreshing. Amazing.

Bottle. Pours slight hazy yellow with small head. Smell is incredible sour funk, florida beach, lemony. Taste follows with more intensity in the citrus taste, lemon, fresh salt, tropical fruit, spice, acidic. Amazing stuff.

Bottle. Hazy hay yellow liquid with small white head. Aroma of lemon peel, grapefruit, apples, barnyard, salt and coriander. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of lemon peel, grapefruit, salt and apples. Light to medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Nice.

Pours a hazy pale yellow with quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is of salty air, citrus fruits and acidity. Taste is salty and has hints of tart fruit juice. Interesting. Id say the taste is not as smooth as the regular Westbrook Gose. I prefer the taste of the original. Palate is light and refreshing. Overall, a unique beer that Im glad I got to try. But Ill stick to the original Westbrook Gose.

Draft. Poured a hazy pale gold with a medium-sized white head. Aroma was bright, tart citrus, tropical fruit, some funky yeastiness. Flavor is that, plus a hint of salt (less pronounced than in their regular gose). The tartness is quite acidic, slightly lactic, not at all vinegary. I love this. Wish theyd can it!

Glad this brew made its way back to the taps of the Brick Store. Pours a murky pale yellow with fizzy white head. Scent is citrus and what I can only assume is Yuzu juice. Flavor is wonderfully tart but balanced by the fruit notes. Light effervescent body. I hope Westbrook cans this so I can drink it on the beach next summer. Draft - Brick Store Pub - Decatur, GA
On tap at Biercab. Hazy yellow colour with white head. Citric, lactic aroma. Citric, lactic, acidic and tart taste, slightly salty. Light to medium body.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity citrus sour aroma. Fruity spicy citrus sour lemon flavor. Has a fruity sour citrus finish.

Bottle from Sweet Grass. Hazy yellow pour with a bubbly white head. Aroma is very sour, pedio, salt brine, star fruit, kiwi with hints a lactic acid. Very sour fruit flavor, salty, tart and bits of lactic sourness. Gozu is a very nice addition to the already outstanding Gose.

09-JAN-2013, bottle @Clipper tasting, from Kihoskh.
Hazy, milky, yellow with fine White head.
Aroma is citrus and fruit. Yeast, wheat, and tarness.
Taste the same but the salt is evident. Not as tart as I would have liked it. The Yuzu does add some bitterness to it but I sense no hops. Creamy, soft carbonation. Very refreshing.

Pours light and golden with a white soapy head that fades rather fast. Aroma is like lemonade, champagne, citrus, pineapple. Taste is the same, but less clean and with a salty background. Theres a wheat-malty spine on which everything else is attached, including the tart sourness. Its fizzy and sparkling in your mouth, but thin, like sparkling water. Overall very enjoyable, imagine it would be perfect on a warm summer day. Nice!

BOD 10/23/13. Hazy golden pour with very little head and lacing. The nose is slightly sour citrus against a slight mineral background. Light medium body, low carbonation level but an almost slick mouthfeel. Quite an interesting taste that is a nice balance of sour, citrus and salt. Yuzu juice yields a nice tartness that carries beyond the smooth finish. Another very well crafted ale from Westbrook and a new take on an old style.

Bottle @ Johns, Århus newyear tasting. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, loads of citrus, lemon, orangepeel. Flavor is wheat, yeast, salt, lemon, orangepeel. Thin to medium body, average carbonation, acidic finish. 291213

Bottle. Creamtý white good mostly lasting head, yellow cloudy colour. Light malty and hoppy powerfull citrus notes, Moderate oranhe aroma. Ligjht bitter flavor. Short light bitter finish. oily palate.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich citrus, lemon juice, malt, little lactose acid and hops. Nice and tart.

Bottle, 4%. Milky yellow with small white head. Aroma is wheat, spices, citrus and a little salt. Flavour is malt, citrus, lemon, little sweet, little salt, little acid, little sour, quite citric and a little dry.
22 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy yellow, slight greenish and with a small white head. Aroma is Schweppes Lemon. Citrusy, tart and dry. Lingering citrusy. Loads of citrus peel. Dry and citric far finish.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy citrus and coriander. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter and light acidic. Dry, light bitter and light acidic finish with a touch of salt. 291213
Bottle at home. Cloudy yellow - white head. Aroma of yuzu, citrus, acid, fruity, rather salty, milkey sourness, pineapple notes, apple, fresh ctric, grape fruit, light malty.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2014 On Draft at brewery, light and citrusy, salty and thin, very complex and interesting, disjointed
Hazy straw color with a nice fluffy white head. Sour, juicy, citrus, salty, hints of coriander. Just a phenomenal job of blending the gose with the yuzu. Simply crushable!
Pours a light hazy yellow with no head. Aroma of lemon, wheat, grain and lacto. Taste is sour, citrus, wheat and other tropical fruit. Lots of lemon. Really good!!!
Un nez de tarte au citron sans équivoque qui se termine avec un arrière-goût salin et fromagé qui nous a tous rappelé les cheetos. Vraiment étrange .

poured from a 22oz bottle into a snifter.

Appearance: cloudy, golden yellow. A thin head leaves a good bit of lacing

Smell: lemon, yuzu(?), other citrus, and a touch of malt.

Taste: wow! hints the front of the tongue with a momentary sweet and fruity flavor, but this is quickly followed by strong sour flavor. Lemony and sour but not like the puckering sourness of an actual lemon. 

Mouthfeel: medium-light body; nicely carbonated; dry finish. 

Overall: Better than their regular Gose. Loads of well-crafted flavor in a low ABV brew.

From tap at Community Tap Greenville, SC. Pours a hazy orange/gold color. Aroma was lemon, yuzu fruit and spice. Taste was similar to aroma with an addition of malt to balance the fruitiness. Both odd and wonderful!

22oz bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours hazy golden pale yellow. Nose is tart tropical fruit, straw. Taste is fruity, orange, lemon, tangerine, medium tartness. Finish is tart citrus, salty, straw, cereal, grain notes. Delicious.

Bottle at Tony/Jim BA Birthday Extravaganza 2013 (Western Springs, IL). Pours a well hazed straw yellow hue. Glowing body with a brighter creamy white head atop. Mellow layer stays as a thicker ring, ok lacing. Aromas are salty and tart, lemon meets bready malts, gentle salt and straw. Some cobwebs, sodium element hits well. Tart citrus, gentle bread and grass. Initial is firmly sour up front, lemony and yuzu elements make this a bit puckering. Middle quickly shows lactic life, yogurt and straw meet salt, flaked wheat and gentle dough. Cleaner light body is quite drinkable, sourness really quite nice. Backend is tart, a touch salty but really that lactic and citrus fruit vibe really pprovide some synergy. Sour and quite crushable. Finish is tart, a bit slick and yogurty, citric acidity. Nice stuff. Really good flavors.

Draft at One Mile House with Linh. Pours a hazed orange golden body with thick white lacing. Aroma is orange zest and hop at first, but after a minute theres a full bouquet of lime, salt and funky citrus. Mouthfeel is bright and tart with notes of salt covered limes and orange cream sickle. So great.

Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with white head. Nose and taste of salt, sour wheat, coriander, wild yeast, sour lemon, yuzu, tart citrus, nectarine juice and lime wedge. Lighter medium body. Fizzy carbonation. Beautiful.

Bottle thanks to icehawk ! Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a finger or two of white fizzy foam. The nose is punch you in the face new zealand sauvignon blanc, grapefruit, lime wholly citrus lovers unite ! The palate follows the nose with huge grapefruit, yuzu and lime acidity punching your palate back and fourth with a fizzy pop... damn I fucking love this beer ! So tasty and a nice shot of salty saline in the lingering finish just keeps you going back for more and more ! Delicious.

Tap at The Jeffrey. Pours hazy peach. Nose of yuzu and ocean brine. Tastes of Yuzu, peach skin, oranges, salty, ginger, leaves, and champagne. Kinda like a mimosa but very tasty brew u could find yourself pounding. Westbrook has been putting out a lot of fun stuff.

Sample at the Beers from the Bikes Villes tasting on 11/08/2013. Murky yellow-orange pour with a medium off-white head that diminishes gradually to a wispy film. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tropical fruits and bready malt. Light-bodied with flavors of citrus, melons and toasted malt. Not sure what Yuzu juice is but I assume this is what it tastes like. The finish is semi-sweet with a tropical fruit aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Pours a beautiful murky peach color with a small fizzy white head. A lot of what I assume is yuzu fruit (never seen it before) on the nose, reminiscent of lemonade, the saltiness is subdued a bit from the regular gose, and a nice wheat note. Wow, the taste blows me away. Still plenty of what I assume is yuzu fruit which adds wonderfully to the very lemon heavy flavors of the Gose, nice tart and salty notes, sourness is almost cut in half from what I remember of the Gose, nice lemony wheat flavor, and a really nice orange flavor as well. Im not too familiar with Yuzu, but this is really delicious. Didnt think there was much you could do to improve the regular Gose, but this does it pretty firmly. I very much hope to see this again.

22oz bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with a white head. Aromas of Yuzu juice Im guessing as I dont think Ive every smelled something like this - and it was good. Citrus, lemons, and a lighter saltiness.

Hazy golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of yuzu juice, citrus, tropical fruits, and faint toast. Taste of yuzu, lemon, light citrus, salt and a dry finish.

Pours thick cloudy lemon in color with a bright snowy white head. Aroma and flavor are unique and refreshing bringing ocean breeze fresh salt and lemon citrus notes. Flavor brings lemon juice smooth on a thick but excellently proportioned body.

11/8/13. On tap at Sweet Grass for their Westbrook Tap Takeover! Super hazy orange pour, murky and cloudy, under a small off-white head that fades. Awesome burst of fresh citrus in the aroma, like sweet oranges and tangerines, the yuzu I guess. Tart flavor, not too sour, and another burst of tasty orange and citrus in the flavor. Man, I could pound these. Good stuff!

Big fresh squeezed citrus juice aroma with some tart notes. Light, lively mouthfeel with tart citrus followed by salty, and tart notes of the gose. Lots of intense flavor makes this less sessionable than regular gose, but is still very good.
